snippet: Electronic Arts’s new SimCity requires an online connection, even for the private single-player mode, and so far this week its servers haven’t been up to the task.
abstract: Stephen Totilo notes that Electronic Arts' latest version of video game SimCity, which now requires an online connection, has been plagued with technical problems in its first week of release; many users complain they have been unable to access game as result of faulty servers that could not handle immediate influx of players.
lead_paragraph: Electronic Arts’s new SimCity requires an online connection, even for the private single-player mode, and so far this week its servers haven’t been up to the task.

headline.seo: SimCity From Electronic Arts, Plagued by Server Problems
headline.main: Gridlock Plagues the New Online-Only SimCity
headline.print_headline: Gridlock Plagues the New Online-Only SimCity
